Expected result: The Welcome Back screen is shown.
The Ether balance is shown on the overview. The wallet address is shown on the overview. The selected network is Ethereum Mainnet.

Test steps: Keep Ethereum Mainnet as the selected network. Click on account menu icon. Click "Add account or hardware wallet".
On "Add account" modal, click "Add hardware wallet" button.
Expected result: "Connect a hardware wallet" screen is shown. User can choose between different options to connect a hardware: Ledger, Trezor, Lattice, or QR-based. "Continue" button is disabled.

Test steps: Choose an option to connect hardware wallet.
Preconditions: We need to have a hardware wallet setted up to test this functionality.

Test steps: Plug the hardware wallet directly into computer, then unlock it.
Expected result: Hardware wallet is detected by MetaMask. "Select an account" screen is shown on MetaMask, accounts on hardware wallet are shown on this screen.
Notes: If you use Ledger, you need to open the Ethereum app on Ledger. If you use Trezor, make sure you use the correct passphrase.

Test steps: Choose one or multiples accounts that user wants to connect. Then click "Unlock".
Click account menu icon to open accounts list.
Expected result: In accounts list, all selected hardware wallet accounts are shown, and they are all flagged with harware wallet name to be distinguished from other accounts.
The Ether balance for the selected hardware wallet account is shown on the overview. The selected account address is shown on the overview. The selected network is Ethereum Mainnet.
